page.title: 12STREETS AND BUILDINGS x.
page.content: The Factories of Messrs Barker. The name Barker means : one who collects oak bark for use in the process of tanning leather. The first known factory belonging to the Barker family was in London End. A Photograph exists showing the factory and its workers in circa 1890.From this site the company moved to premises in Station Road.This new factory was built in 1880 and soon the original works was sold (c.1900).After several developments to the Station Rd site, a vast new factory was begun to accommodate all shoe making processes under one roof. The scale of the building has shaken many villagers as the proposed factory has grown.It can be seen from all directions but on balance is accepted by the majority as employment prospects are enhanced.
